column4: Why my gutsy tries to modprobe /lib/modules/2.6.22-14-rt/ubuntu/media/snd-hda-intel/snd-hda~ntel.ko, instead /lib/modules/2.6.22-14-rt/kernel/sound/pci/hda/snd-hda~ntel.ko, How can I correct that isue?
I got a new module version to be installed
depelte the extaneous module and run sudo depmod -a
I did but when i reboot it tries to mod probe that old module
even with depmod? I don't think so
I think I will copy and overwrite the old module with the one on the kernel directory
I loaded the new module, it worked fine
But when i reboot i got symbols errors, cuz its trying to load the old one in the ubuntu folder
you said you did depmod -a not sudo depmod -a
